page.title: 09INTERVIEW WITH THE PRIEST
page.content:
Father Engelen is of Dutch origin and has been the Catholic priest in charge of St.James' Church since 1969. Before his appointment here, he was priest at Kennoway and used to cycle to Elie and other villages on the coast of Fife to carry out his pastoral duties.When appointed to St.Andrews, he continued to cycle to Anstruther every Wednesday to teach at Waid Academy.
The congregation at St.James' comes from St.Andrews, Guardbridge, Ceres, Largo Ward, Peat Inn, Boarhills and Kingsbarns. The average size of the congregtion in summer is 600 and in winter 440. Last Sunday (7th July 1985) there were 920 people and the largest recorded congregation is 1317. Mass is celebrated at 9.00am, 11.00am and 4.00pm and there is an extra Mass and an Evening Vigil Mass in summer.
